website_summaries.verdict: Numerous versatile tools for a low price. If you're looking for a large set and savings, this is the best value available.
pros: Comes with 15 inch and 15 metric keys
An unbeatable price considering all the set has to offer
cons: Though most of the tools feel sturdy, the smaller keys are a bit flimsy

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest set around but, it'll do.
customer_reviews.text: I received these today via usps. Before I opened the actual Amazon packaging. I could hear what sounded to be little pieces rattling around. Upon opening the said Amazon packaging, the box to the actual case of allen wrenches had tape on the outside of packaging like someone had used these and returned them before to the seller. Upon discovery on the inside of the actual red case to these. The allen wrenches were scattered all over the inside and a greasy like substance(like someone's potato chip finger grease) was on them. I organized the wrenches by size and other than that no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jaywil

customer_reviews.title: quality of Allen wrench set-3 star
customer_reviews.text: wrenches are good quality- storage box is a pos. when arrived wrenches we mostly loose in box -took me about 45 minutes and 2 pair of magnifying glasses to return wrenches to propereslot in box each wrench has it's size stamped on one side in very small letters-but they are there-other than theplastic storage container the set is in of quality which is a bummer because I like to know which size I should use next if current selections inaccurate should I change size up or down.Iiin the steel the wrenches are made of-seems to be of high quality-Iwould buy again if need be.good set- not great but plenty good for home handy man.
customer_reviews.author: Fredalso

customer_reviews.title: I bought this kit because it was the cheapest way I could buy 1 tiny Allen key.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Set has a lot if different sizes. Cheap price. Cons: Wrenches are weak, slightly bent when you get them. As i stated above I needed 1 tiny allen key that this set had for an adjustment key for a laser. No one sells just that 1 allen key without paying through the nose for shipping. I would never bought this kit otherwise and don't recommend it for heavy use. If you are buying this to put your IKEA stuff together, this is your kit. If you are using this to work on a motorcycle or industrial purpose keep moving on.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Medium quality, but the price is right.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a low-quality allen wrench set set, but it's also not a top-quality set. The larger pieces are great—well-finished and sturdy. The smaller pieces? Things are a little shakier there as the metal used isn't particularly rigid at those gauges and they're more like pieces of flexible wire that happen to be hex-shaped. The case is also not quite perfect, as it doesn't hold each size in place quite perfectly—there is some flopping about and falling out. But that said, for the price, what you get is perfectly satisfactory for most applications, and it's not one of those toolsets that will have you swearing under your breath because they just don't work.
customer_reviews.author: PRNLM

customer_reviews.title: VERY, VERY POORLY MADE. Smallest sizes are unusable
customer_reviews.text: VERY cheaply made hex key set. The smallest sizes and so twisted and poorly made that they're unusable. Even the largest keys are twisted, soft and look terrible. Spend the extra money and buy a better brand name unless you don't have any choice. Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Better then average
customer_reviews.text: God knows how many alan wrench sets I've purchased in my life time. you always seem to loose the one you need and then over time they become useless. I really like Tekton, because they are better then brands in the same price range. The small alan keys fall out, but I can't remember one time I've ever used those anyway. They are long enough for anything I need to reach, and they are cheap enough to where if I loose a few I'll just buy another set.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Megan

customer_reviews.title: THIS WRENCH SET MEETS ALL MY NEEDS
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before I purchased this wrench set. My set arrived in perfect shape. A couple of the wrenches came loose during shipping but I quickly found their appropriate locations in the plastic case. My problem is I never can find the right hex wrench because they get dropped into one of my tool boxes. This set comes with its own case and it is easy keep track of the wrenches. This set came yesterday and I already used one of the small wrenches to make a repair. Some of the smaller wrenches are not that sturdy; however, the price was great!
customer_reviews.author: Runner45

customer_reviews.title: Great for Guitar Work
customer_reviews.text: I work on guitars, and many times, there are small screws that require very small, or less common allen key sizes. I found and ordered this set, since I'm a fan of Tekton tools, and it has just about every size allen key I could ever need. I found that between the Imperial and Metric wrenches, there is always one that's exactly the right size for what I'm trying to do. The set is very nice, and the wrenches themselves feel very sturdy, even the tiny ones. The case is also very nice, and holds all the keys in place nicely, and keeps them organized. All in all, a very nice hex key set.
customer_reviews.author: Aleks K.

customer_reviews.title: Eventually you will need this
customer_reviews.text: Allen head screws are not something I deal with daily. However, they seem to turn up at in convenient moments. A recent example was chair that was purchased back when and was getting wobbly - the only way to fox that was to snug up some allen head screws. Ikea items are particularly guilty. Anyway the point is that sooner or later nearly every household can use this- eventually. The kit has both metric and US sizes and doesn’t cost much. Buy it before you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Banana skins
customer_reviews.text: Very week material !!! Like working with a wet stick . If you purchase this product,,do not plan on using them ! Give them as a gift to someone you hate ..
customer_reviews.author: Tim king

customer_reviews.title: Nice wrench set but disappointing case
customer_reviews.text: I like that these came with a carrying case but it is too bad that they easily fall out of the case. When they arrived I opened the package to find that most of the wrenches were in a pile. Putting them back showed that the case does not retain them very well, especially the smallest one. I added a strip of masking tape over the wrenches as a set to help retain them in place. Not the best solution but it helps.
customer_reviews.author: Appaloosa

customer_reviews.title: Tons of problems
customer_reviews.text: Case is sharp and needs to be sanded or it will cut you. The covers that separate short and long allen keys are uneven. Terrible quality control. The smaller allen keys were bent and the worst part is the allen keys had machine oil/grease all over them. Spent over half an hour alone cleaning the grease/oil off the allen keys. I've bought many Tekton products and this one is the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set of wrenches for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have several sets of hex wrenches, but recently had to remove an oddball-sized screw that I didn't have a proper wrench for. This set is very complete, has every conceivable size and appears to be very well made. I like how the arms on the metric wrenches are somewhat shorter than the arms on the SAE wrenches, making it easy to tell them apart. I think this is a good value for the money, as well.
customer_reviews.author: F. J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality wrench set
customer_reviews.text: This set is pretty heavy. They must have used better/heavier metal. The keys are sized correctly (as opposed to the cheaper ones that tend to be undersized / wobbly). I have used on couple of projects and I was able to remove some very stubborn screws without bending/damaging the keys. They seem to be holding really well. I am happy with this purchase. This is my second TEKTON set. I bought a different set before and lost it. I bought a slightly different set this time. But the quality is comparable.
customer_reviews.author: Twelve Point

customer_reviews.title: Versatile set, internal casing snap holders are low quality
customer_reviews.text: Well Ill tell you the truth its the wrench holders poorly designed. The case is good in terms of opening and closing. Usually plastic casings dont open or close good or tabs break, but this one beat my skepticism. The only negative feature is the wrenches tend to snap out of place easily, and its annoying to put them back. I like the variety and sizes. It is a great set to have when working on specialty fasteners like aftermarket short hub steering wheels
customer_reviews.author: Erfan223

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good set but missing a piece
customer_reviews.text: Received the set in the mail and was concerned with all of the rattles i heard within the "sealed" box. After opening, I found eight wrenches were loose and not in their proper storage location. Unfortunately, my 30 piece wrench set only had 29 wrenches. The smallest metric, 0.7mm was missing. Tekton appears to have a lifetime replacement guarantee so I will be giving them a call to replace the missing wrench on Monday as I don't feel like returning the entire set.
customer_reviews.author: KJ. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Good Allen Wrench Set with some minor problems
customer_reviews.text: This Allen Wrench set will literally have every single Allen Wrench size you need for the rest if your life. It comes in nicely in a bright red box for easily location. However, I do have two gripes. The first is that some of the wrences when you first get them have some oil on them for that slimey feel, but that's nothing that can't be solved just by wiping it down. The second is that some of the smaller wrenches can easily be bent. However, I'd recommend anyone to get this, especially if they are missing an Allen wrench for any purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Eru

customer_reviews.title: Sloppy Delivery, Case Broken
customer_reviews.text: I opened the case to hear rattling. I open the case and there are red plastic shards from the case being broken. Also, the wrenches (about 1/3) came loose and were freely floating in the case. I haven't tested the torque on the wrenches yet. The tinier wrenches appear very frail (easily will bend). I ordered for the combo of both metric and standard sizes. I am disappointed when I get a brand new item and it's broken. Case might sound stupid but it keeps me from losing the wrenches. I'm disappointed in the QA.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Decent set
customer_reviews.text: This Allen wrench set is nice and definitely holds up however one thing that makes this not perfect is the fact how the box clips the Allen keys in very tight or not at all, when I initially received it half of them weren’t clipped in and I had a bad time trying to get them all neat in the box but now it’s been holding up good
customer_reviews.author: Dominik

customer_reviews.title: They are alright, better products out there.
customer_reviews.text: I own many Tekton tools and while I love all of their producs I was not impressed with this particular item, See "Ares chrome finish high visibility anti slip coating key wrench sets" for sale here on Amazon. I was so impressed with their product that I bought all 4 sets of key wrenches. They are too appealing to the DIY-er's eyes to not get them all.
customer_reviews.author: Penetrator

customer_reviews.title: this is a great high quality and complete allen key set
customer_reviews.text: this is a great high quality and complete allen key set. I use the .050 one a lot and this has one plus 2 that are even smaller, like little needles they are so small not sure what I would use those for but I am prepared.. the case keeps them all sorted and together as I am known for leaving things in the wrong place and never finding them again both inch sizes and that funny mertrik style too so you can work on everything in the world unless they come out with some whitworth size of allens, England, I am looking at you
customer_reviews.author: Tim H

customer_reviews.title: Awesome assortment of Allen Wrenches, Metric and Inch
customer_reviews.text: I found that some of my faucets had metric allen screws when I went to change handles. All the metric wrenches I had were more suited to the automotive or motorcycle needs I have. I needed the short leg of these L shaped wrenches to get into the faucets. With this set, I am now ready for anything with an allen head, and the case holds and arranges them nicely. Don't hesitate to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: sparky51

customer_reviews.title: Go to home depot/ these are trash
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was great for the price. Well, it showed up and the wrenches barely lock into the slots. I opened it and 2 were in place and as I went about solving the puzzle of what went where, I noticed that 1/3 of the wrenches had a slight bend in them. Case is now useless as they wont fit in the spots.
customer_reviews.author: Washington state couple

customer_reviews.title: The case is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Used the hex keys for some very tight screws and they've held up. Not 5* because the carrying case it comes in is trash: opening the case usually provides enough force to dislodge one or two keys, some keys don't fit at all, and the keys are too close such that your finger inevitably dislodges another when selecting your key of choice.
customer_reviews.author: AP Student

customer_reviews.title: For the price you won't do much better. That being said
customer_reviews.text: For the price you won't do much better. That being said, this set is identical to other bargain brand tools (cough cough harbor freight) probably made in the same factory and rebranded by tekton. The case is very cheap, and the smaller sizes are pretty flimsy. For normal mechanical jobs and hardware you will not be disappointed with the "normal" size wrenches. I do wish that the metrics were the same length as the fractional set, they are significantly shorter (see photo comparison)
customer_reviews.author: Skywalker117

customer_reviews.title: Wrenches won't stay put
customer_reviews.text: The wrenches seem fine, but they don't stay put in the plastic case. Not sure if some of the brackets broke off, but every time I open it many of the wrenches fall out and I have to figure out where to put them back. The whole reason I got the set was to keep them organized so it kind of defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Bravoking

customer_reviews.title: I never realized you needed BOTH types till I got caught.
customer_reviews.text: So many hex's around and so many tossed by contractors. I had an incident where I was switching out my dual shower door handle O rings. I got one handle off with a tool box saved hex I had but couldn't get the other off. had the handyman check it....one handle was in inches and the other in metric. Sheesh. That won't happen to me again.
customer_reviews.author: rricks

customer_reviews.title: Nice Well Organized Complete Set of Standard and Metric Hex Key Wrenches
customer_reviews.text: Finally I am done searching for a particular size hex key (Allen wrench) when they are loose and scattered everywhere. This product's sturdy case has virtually every size standard and metric hex wrench each in its own clearly marked snap-in location. One of the best tool buys I have made.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in FL

customer_reviews.title: Ok, just ok
customer_reviews.text: Get what you pay for. The case arrived cracked with all the keys have fallen out. A few of the teeth were broken and took a while to figure out what went where. The have faint size markings on the size once you wipe away the generous oil coating. I have recommended previous tekton items like their torque wrench. This is a pass.
customer_reviews.author: Ibeerian

customer_reviews.title: Used and dirty
customer_reviews.text: This is obviously used and dirty. The wrenches are covered in an oily film that has dripped around the inside of the plastic box they come in. I should’ve known something was not right when I saw the top of the box taped shut, see my photo. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Reluctant Shopper

customer_reviews.title: 2 Stars - Wrenches Loose In Case
customer_reviews.text: The set looks decent but many wrenches were loose in the case. This required that I attempt to put them back in their proper place. I did not appreciate the inconvenience and the potential that some wrenches may be in the wrong slot. You are probably better off buying them at Home Depot or your favorite hardware store to assure you get the right tools in the right slots.
customer_reviews.author: Louis A. Del Monte

customer_reviews.title: Low-cost Option for Occasional Use
customer_reviews.text: With the possible exception of a highly specialized (large) size, this set provides just about every hex wrench option one might desire at a very good price. One should keep in mind that it's a 'standard' hex set, not a refined set, such as available from Wera at a much higher price. However, if one only requires a hex key once in a great while, this set will do for most casual users. If you want a more resilient set with possiblyh a ball-type end, they I'd suggest looking at the Wera, as this set may disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good price, no good quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a set of these cause it was cheap and I wasn't entirely sure what size I needed for a job, so this was great for that. Found that I needed a 1.3mm wrench and the hex key worked great for about a month. Then it started slipping in the socket and it became completely unusable. The coating on the end of the hex key had come off so it no longer could grip the screw head. Luckily, I was able to use the .05inch wrench on the other side of the box. It lasted about a week before having the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mat DeAngelis

customer_reviews.title: Broken box holder...
customer_reviews.text: Just received this set. The outer shipping box and the product box was ok. The 'wrenches ' were all jumbled around inside of a broken red holder. I did count and I have 30 pieces. But were do they go. Are they metric or standard? Guess as I use them I can try and use one and keep trying...
customer_reviews.author: Ric VanHooser

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but a very fragile case
customer_reviews.text: Other than a sort of oily feeling at first, the wrenches themselves are great. The case cracked pretty badly not long after I got it, however, and now they don't like to stay in their slots. A great set if it is going to stay in the toolbox, but not so much on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Sapp

customer_reviews.title: They get the job done
customer_reviews.text: The case kind of sucks, but the hex wrenches are decent. They stood up to some rusty bolts okay, but I also used a bigger size. I haven't used any of the smaller sizes, but they seem a bit weak. If these turn out to last longer than expected, I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Justin A

customer_reviews.title: Solid Alan Keys, Poorly Designed Case.
customer_reviews.text: The Keys themselves are perfect. However, the plastic case does not hold onto them well. When I close the case and carry it, some of the keys fall out and bounce around inside. This can be infuriating when trying to return them into their proper slots (metric vs imperial).
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this set but like others when it arrived the pieces were all mixed up. The set includes extremely small sizes that are hard to find. I bought the set to use on rear sight for a pistol
customer_reviews.author: DRE

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This set is great to have at the ready. I put it to use right away by fixing a bathtub faucet and a leaky kitchen sink. It comes in a tidy case that's a little hard to keep closed, but I'll live with it since the price can't be beat. Was able to discard a collection of hex wrenches that accumulated over the years from Ikea and other furniture purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Anomalisa

customer_reviews.title: Virtually Every Allen Size You'll Ever Need
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic allen wrench set. The only complaint I have is a minor one: one wrench on each side has trouble staying in its spot, mainly because the case takes a bit of force to close and probably snaps it out of place. But this has to have virtually every size of allen wrench you'll ever need in either a home-repair or auto-repair situation.
customer_reviews.author: Rhydon Johansen

customer_reviews.title: Missing the 3/32 wrench which is an important reason I bought the set.
customer_reviews.text: I work with automated wire cutting, stripping, and terminating machines and use both standard and metric wrenches on a daily basis. I needed a better set than you get at the local hardware store because I kept stripping out the 1/8th and 3/32nd. Well, the 3/32nd is missing so it pretty much negates part of the reason I bought the set.
customer_reviews.author: Dedra K Dehart

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool Set
customer_reviews.text: Awesome addition to my tool collection. If you work with a lot of hex head screws for electronics or modeling work, this can be really handy to have, especially for those really small headed screws. The container could be a little better, the latching part on mine doesn't work so well. But after a little DIY and some little latches from the hardware store, we're back in business.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle K.

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this WHOLE SET to fix a loose clip on my pocket knife but none of the sizes fits properly in the hex screws on my knife clip...The one that does “fit” doesn’t grab the corners properly and slips through when trying to tighten.. I am sure the bigger sizes work great but the smaller one are trash in my opinion.. Some come bent, and the metal seems weak af... In retrospect you get what you pay for I guess..
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I used it to tighten two front sights on my 9 mm handgun because they came a little loose
customer_reviews.text: Each piece fits securely in the box it is a very sturdy hard plastic box that closes tightly I am very happy with my purchase. I ordered it received it and used it for what i needed all within 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S. Walcott

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: I recently went through my tool box and donated all my mismatched and incomplete sets to Goodwill. I bought this to replace my dreadful collection of mismatched allen wrenches, now it's easy to find what I want and I have all the sizes in one place, brilliant! This is my second Tekton tool purchase, I also bought their wrench sets to replace all my mismatched and incomplete wrench collections. I've been very happy with the quality of these tools.
customer_reviews.author: Mark KingTop Contributor: Bass Guitars & Gear

customer_reviews.title: I've got every key I might need now - Hooray!
customer_reviews.text: I love having ANY hex key I might need now. Having something come loose and being unable to tighten it because I'd lost the key was driving me crazy. Since I got this I've been able to fix a window crank, mend a screen door's hardware, and take parts off a fairly new cat tower - 3 different sized keys, two things I'd never HAD keys for, one I'd lost the key for. For me, it's invaluable.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Purse

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The one star is only because the case was decent. The wrenches started to bend when I was using them. I didn't even apply much pressure either. Do not buy these. Theres a reason their only eleven bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, wide selection of sizes
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, wide selection of the Allen wrench sizes from SAE to Metric all easy to find in one well designed holder. No more fumbling around in a loose pouch or limited all-in-one holder for the size you need. This one has common and less common sizes which is great for working on items that use unusual sizes.
customer_reviews.author: DRS

customer_reviews.title: that is real burn Your money
customer_reviews.text: This set of tools is not complete, and the quality is not enough. I used it twice and it rotted away. My loyal advice is not to waste your money by buying this product. Please consider carefully
customer_reviews.author: yiyanho

customer_reviews.title: Item was used!
customer_reviews.text: I don't mind buying things used, or returns; I DO mind paying for new and getting something used. When I opened this set, it was covered in oil and half of the wrenches were not in their slots. A couple were bent, showing previous usage.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Menke

customer_reviews.title: Buy a more expensive set
customer_reviews.text: Product came is wrenches laying everywhere and case broken in some spots. Buy a more expensive set.
customer_reviews.author: charles j holminski

customer_reviews.title: I like the long neck on them
customer_reviews.text: very complete set, everything from the smallest to the biggest. I like the long neck on them, easy to get into far reaching places. only two problems is they were a bit oily (I had to wipe them down), and if they bounce around a bunch (like in the back of a car) they slip loose from their spot. easily solved by putting a thin piece of foam in the case to hold them in.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Donato

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT and MOST OF ALL AMAZING COMPANY
customer_reviews.text: I received my set with 2 missing short wrenches, 0.9 and 0.7. I contacted tekton directly and within days I had the missing wrenches replaced. I know anything can happen and I wasnt upset they were missing but was disappointed. Tekton resolved the issue without any hassle and further inconvenience. GREAT PRODUCT AND MOST OF ALL AMAZING COMPANY. THANK YOU.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Good set, covers most needs, durable case.
customer_reviews.text: Good set with many different sizes for various needs. Seem to be pretty strong, as I haven't had any start to strip at all. I like that the case is strong and closes firmly. I keep these in my tool bag so I'm not sure how well the case would repel water. I would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O.

customer_reviews.title: Precision Made Quality Allen Wrenches
customer_reviews.text: Actually bought this set when discovered another set was just approximating sizes. All wrenches I have tried have been tight exact fit for bolt/screw. Smaller wrenches are plenty strong and allow firm setting without breaking or bending. Case has labeled spot for each wrench and they lock in so if you pu them back you won't lose them. Good price for such a great set.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Mclean

customer_reviews.title: Product Review
customer_reviews.text: This set is great, the moment I received it had use for it. I was able to adjust a sight of a hand gun for which I had not small enough tool till now. I highly recommend this product as an addition to your tools.
customer_reviews.author: lui

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy hex set....
customer_reviews.text: I got this set when doing a home project and not knowing exactly what size I needed. It's come in handy quite a few times already. The hex keys are very durable and strong. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C. Castro

customer_reviews.title: For Tekton could have been better
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that these were not as expected as I have purchased Tekton products in the past. It may have been a bad batch, however sizing is good. The ones I received had a slight rust coating and had left over machining process oil over them. The case itself is poorly made and difficult to open.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Had exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small, specific type of Allen wrench to remove a freezer door handle before moving it inside a home. The wrench was just what I needed. The only small downside I will say is it can be tricky placing the wrenches back in the carrying case/holder. Otherwise a good 20 or so dollars spent. Will never need another Allen wrench again.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great set of hex wrenches
customer_reviews.text: I needed a set of hex wrenches to attach accessories to my mountain bike, and the items all had different size bolts and this set fit them all. I highly recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Lemons

customer_reviews.title: It works, but the case needs work
customer_reviews.text: The case feels extremely cheap, some of the slots, especially on the smaller wrenches, don't hold the allen wrenches in place. The tools themselves are just fine, which is the most important part. Having said that, I have to be extremely careful putting everything back and making sure they don't get rattled around.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Mulholland

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: Box came and all of the keys were out of their clips, but not a big deal. The keys are average quality, nothing special that I have noticed so far. The case is cheap and is not made to fit each key properly, and is hard to open and close. This set did not live up to my previous experiences with Tekton, and I don’t think I would purchase this set again.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Adams

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: Nice set. They come in a nice plastic case with sizes clearly marked. They day they got here I put them to use fixing a cat tree in our house. A very fair price.
customer_reviews.author: WJM Kennebunk,Me

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: I got a set that had already been opened and a few of the wrenches were already bent. Definitely not for hard use but works for someone looking for basic allen wrenches for small jobs that don't require much force.
customer_reviews.author: JustAguy

customer_reviews.title: Good tool bad carrying case
customer_reviews.text: The wrenches themselves are good but the case is very poor. They came all messy and the plastics holding them broke during shipping. I’ll throw the red case away. Disappointed in that part
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Torjman

customer_reviews.title: Simple Product
customer_reviews.text: These wrenches are great. Very sturdy and comes with pretty much any size you can ask for. I would recommend this product to anyone needing some new wrenches.
customer_reviews.author: Cyanide_Martyr

customer_reviews.title: Wrenches work fine, case sucks.
customer_reviews.text: The first time, it was shipped to me with a broken case. This could easily be the shipping and handling, but I’d like to see a tool case hold up better. Upon replacement, a couple wrenches will get loose on the case, which is annoying upon opening it up. The wrenches work fine but I that think I could have gotten better value elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Organization-wise, these could have come loose in a Zip-Lok.
customer_reviews.text: Can't speak to the quality of the wrenches, sure they're fine, but the plastic "holder" does anything but. Especially the small ones. Sorted them properly back in the case and closed it carefully. Re-opened it. Small wrenches all over the place. Lousy storage device, but consider the source. China, of course.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good tools, cheap case
customer_reviews.text: I got this in the mail this evening. I picked up the package and could hear parts rattling around. Once I opened up the tool box, half of the Allen wrenches fall out onto the ground. Several red pieces of plastic also fell out of the box. Once I picked everything up and attempted to assemble it, I noticed that the Allen keys were no longer able to be snapped into place due to the plastic retention tabs breaking. Other than this, I’m guessing the tools will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: The wrench always fell loose
customer_reviews.text: Every time I closed it up, most of the wrenches fell loose and I have to figure out what went where. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Devries

customer_reviews.title: Spend up for something better.
customer_reviews.text: Wrenches seem fine for the most part, strange length differences. Case is cheap plastic though and arrived cracked with structural elements broken off, wrenches exploded out all over the place with the top resealed using Scotch tape. Says new, so I have to assume this was manufacturer condition.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Quality
customer_reviews.text: Majority sizes are fine, but the smallest sizes are basically a bent peice of wire which will not work. So product not as description says....
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good selection of sizes.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted set that had a huge variety in sized. The smallest hex screws I used it for was a cover off a graphics card. It didn't strip or wear when using it.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes that this would be a nice set, but when it arrived, several wrenches were loose in the case. The case is more cheaply made than I expected - the molding is not very refined and some of the wrenches won't stay put very well. I need to travel with this a lot and it just wasn't going to work if the wrenches keep coming loose in the case. Although the wrenches appear to be of decent quality metal, the smallest wrench was bent. I returned it and got a smaller set with a firmer case at the local home improvement store instead.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have both metric and inch hex wrenches
customer_reviews.text: Save the box because any wrench below 1/8 or 3mm is not marked but the box shows how to identify the small ones. Most of the wrenches are greases coated.
customer_reviews.author: Steve A

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, save your money
customer_reviews.text: You can go to Tractor Supply or a Big box store for a 1/4 of the price. You cannot even read the imprinted numbers what is metric or SAE. Please save your money.
customer_reviews.author: bman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tools!
customer_reviews.text: Tekton makes amazing tools. These are no different. I got these to help relocate standing desks at work, and they didn’t round off, and did a fantastic sturdy job.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Just okay...
customer_reviews.text: I gave these 3 stars because although the are exactly what I was looking for, they feel cheap like they might break when I'm using them. They were also covered in this dark greasy oil. Hmmmm... They are just average. I probably will look for the Craftsman set.
customer_reviews.author: SavvyShopper

customer_reviews.title: they are quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to adjust my crimson trace on my gun. it was on point, didn't have to. this is a quality product to have for any job that needs an allen wrench, they go from 0 to 100. that's false, but you know what I mean
customer_reviews.author: james torti

customer_reviews.title: It’s a USD 11.00 set...
customer_reviews.text: Plastic case broken, smaller keys not straight... It’s a low cost set but the quality could be a little bit more higher. The only reason of not returning item is my lack of time (bought it in US - delivered to Amazon Locker - before go home to ).
customer_reviews.author: A. Oliveira

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This set looks and feels so cheap. The case doesn't do a good job of holding the keys in place. Giving it a good shake will make some of they keys fall out of their holders each time.
customer_reviews.author: kronos

customer_reviews.title: Bad case
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Durability of the actual wrenches seems to be... fine. Cons: Case is low-quality. Fittings for the wrenches aren't tight and they wobble and fall out of place. The smaller wrenches don't even attempt to stay in their place. The smaller wrenches all arrived out of their place and bent to some degree. Case can be hard to open.
customer_reviews.author: Daaok

customer_reviews.title: Smallest hex keys I could find
customer_reviews.text: This set was the only I could find that had hex keys under 1mm. And there are set screws that small, on binoculars. It fit perfectly. The other sizes seem well made. This deserves a special place in my tool set.
customer_reviews.author: helekoa

customer_reviews.title: The case is bad?
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure the allen's will work fine for general purpose work around the house etc., but the storage case leaves a lot to be desired. Mine did anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Pap44

customer_reviews.title: I have had SO much trouble finding a good quality set of hex wrenches and I am very ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had SO much trouble finding a good quality set of hex wrenches and I am very pleased with this set so far. Packaging was very durable, the cases on systems like this are usually broken as soon as you take them out for the first time. I have used a few sizes so far and they seem very durable, however, some of the sizing seems slightly inconsistant. Overall, because of the value I think I may order an additional set or two just to have as a back up, theyre very nice overall.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Shaver

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I do like the variety of the sizes and the casing is nice. It came quickly and all parts were accounted for!
customer_reviews.author: K. Leo Johnson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great set of hex key wrench!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I do all fixing around the house and having this set of hex key wrench makes the job gets done faster and easier. They are made with good quality of metal.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Great tools
customer_reviews.text: Really liked these. They seem to be very sturdy. Haven't had them long enough to see how long they will be durable. But it met my need very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent set.
customer_reviews.text: The smaller ones like to end up loose in the case but that's to be expected with such an ABS injection molded case. That being said even the smaller keys seem pretty strong for their sizes. Nice little set at good price.
customer_reviews.author: hazonku

customer_reviews.title: Sorry for the short review but the seller does a great job at describing the product I find it silly ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this as part of our customer omboarding toolkit. It does as advertised and hasn't failed us yet. Sorry for the short review but the seller does a great job at describing the product I find it silly doing it again. These little guys are great for getting into computer parts that are meant to prevent the average person for getting into parts of computer equipment they shouldn't.
customer_reviews.author: Joe K

customer_reviews.title: No Mixing Metric and Inch
customer_reviews.text: Greatest thing about this product is not mixing up metric with inch because they are different lengths.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S. Randall

customer_reviews.title: A tool with the reach and leverage I needed
customer_reviews.text: Although I have start inserts for sockets, the star insert can fall out of the socket in difficult to reach locations. These start wrenches provide the reach needed with the leverage to get the torque I needed and they are strong and will not easily break. All of the sizes I need are contained in the set. They were very inexpensive compared to other sources and products. These were a find for me!
customer_reviews.author: roy Lindseys house cambreys package

customer_reviews.title: Tools work great! Case could be nicer.
customer_reviews.text: Allen wrenches work as advertised, nice and strong. The only downside to this set is the case itself, as the allen wrenches have a tendency to fall out at inopportune times if you bump it too hard. Otherwise, nice set, good value!
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: 30 piece SAE and Metric Hex Key Wrench Set
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased that this set of wrenches includes both metric and SAE sizes. The case is handy although a bit on the large size. The hole in the rear of the case is convenient for mounting the case on a peg-board. The wrenches are made of a good quality steel and have held up well after a few months of use. The range of wrench sizes is sufficiently broad that I've always had the proper wrench for every job (primarily assembly and dis-assembly of cages for large parrots).
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: Case does not hold wrench well
customer_reviews.text: The case does not hold each wrench well. They fall out even when the case is closed. It’s a mess. I then have to guess each size when I need them.
customer_reviews.author: I am me.

customer_reviews.title: Great Set of Hex Key Wrenches
customer_reviews.text: This set is quite complete and consists of both SAE & Metric in most every common size. It is of decent quality and comes in a nice case. The case was a major selling point as it is much more organized. Most of the other alternatives had no case. The excellent reviews helped make my decision to purchase these. I also have the all in one hex tool variety but they can limit movement in tight places because of bulkiness. I like this set a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer NY

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal - Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Nice set. I'm very pleased with these and they're longer than I expected. It's also nice to have both inch AND metric bundled together in the same case. The case could use a better clasp, but this is still an excellent product for the price. I can easily see why it's "Amazon's Choice".
customer_reviews.author: AnkleBuster

customer_reviews.title: Good BUT..
customer_reviews.text: A few comments mentioned it but it’s true they don’t really stay in place but it does the job so I’m happy
customer_reviews.author: Brandon perez

customer_reviews.title: Great service.
customer_reviews.text: Giving this 5 stars for the support from the manufacturer. I ordered this set just for the very small wrenches that came in it. I needed to tighten some very small screws on my pocket knife. The first two went fine, but the hex wrench stripped out on the third. Keep in mind these are extremely small wrenches and it does not take much to damage them. I contacted the manufacturer and they sent me a replacement wrench in no time at all. 5 stars for standing behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is how I received my set. Additionally one is missing.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Boulay

product_meta.title: TEKTON Hex Key Wrench Set, 30-Piece (.028-3/8 inch, 0.7-10 mm) | 25253
product_meta.description:
Style:Hex Key Wrench Set

Stored in a convenient folding case, the TEKTON 30-pc. Hex Key Set offers the most common inch and metric hex wrench sizes to remove and install most socket cap screws found in cars, furniture, equipment, and more. The versatile long arm/short arm design offers extra reach on one end and extra leverage on the other. Made from heat-treated steel, these wrenches will deliver years of consistent performance. Precisely sized ends are chamfered to slide easily into fastener, reducing wear on the wrench and damage to fastener head. The unique hinged storage case opens flat, making it easier to get wrenches in and out, and has high-visibility size markings for fast size selection.

 Set Includes: 

 * 15-pc. long pattern hex key wrenches: 0.028, 0.035, 0.050, 1/16, 5/64, 3/32, 7/64, 1/8, 9/64, 5/32, 3/16, 7/32, 1/4, 5/16, 3/8 in. 
 * 15-pc. short pattern hex key wrenches: 0.7, 0.9, 1.3, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 4.5, 5, 5.5, 6, 7, 8, 10 mm 
 * Includes storage case
feature_bullets: Precisely sized, chamfered, straight ends offer a snug fit and insert smoothly into fastener head, reducing wear
Black oxide finish protects against corrosion without added plating that could chip off under high-stress contact
Long arm/short arm design offers extended reach on one end and extra leverage on the other
Hinged storage case opens flat, making it easier to get wrenches in and out
Easy-to-read sizes marked on case for fast size selection

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,283 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
